User provide high-level research directi.Format: Natural language query describing a research problem or challenge.
User provide high-level research directi.Example: The need to reduce the memory footprint and training time in finetuning large language models...
User provide high-level research directi.Role in workflow: Serves as the initial input to define the research context and guide literature retrieval and idea generation.

Query Decomposition.Method details: User queries are expanded and clarified using prompt engineering to extract technical terms and provide detailed background.
Query Decomposition.Outputs: Transformed, detailed background and extracted keywords.
Query Decomposition.Example: Transforming a brief user query into a detailed research background and extracting keywords like 'memory footprint', 'training time', etc.
Query Decomposition.Role in workflow: Improves the accuracy and relevance of subsequent literature retrieval and idea generation.

Structural or Entity Decomposition.Method details: LLM-based entity extraction identifies key entities/keywords from user queries and paper content.
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Example: Extracting entities such as 'large language models', 'optimizer states', 'intermediate activations'.
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Role in workflow: Enables targeted keyword-based retrieval and semantic expansion.

Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Method details: Backgrounds and ideas from papers and user queries are encoded into vector embeddings using a text-matching embedding model (jina-embedding-v3).
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Inputs: Summarized backgrounds and ideas from papers and user queries.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Example: Encoding the background of a user query and comparing it to paper embeddings for similarity search.
Textual or Knowledge Embedding.Role in workflow: Enables semantic-based literature retrieval beyond keyword matching.

Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Method details: Clustering and filtering are applied to retrieved papers to reduce redundancy and ensure diversity, based on idea similarity.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Inputs: Set of retrieved papers from SKC retrieval.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Outputs: Filtered, diverse set of relevant papers.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Example: Clustering papers with similar ideas and selecting representative ones for further processing.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Role in workflow: Ensures the literature provided to the idea generation phase is non-redundant and diverse.

Literature data Retrieval Citation-Netwo.Method details: Papers are retrieved based on co-citation relationships; if two papers are frequently cited together, both are included.
Literature data Retrieval Citation-Netwo.Example: If p1 is retrieved and p2 is often co-cited with p1, p2 is added to the retrieval set.
Literature data Retrieval Citation-Netwo.Role in workflow: Captures latent relationships and expands the literature context for idea generation.

Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Method details: Semantic embeddings of user queries and paper backgrounds are compared to retrieve topically similar papers.
Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Inputs: User query embedding, paper background embeddings.
Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Example: Retrieving papers whose background embeddings are most similar to the user's query embedding.
Literature data Retrieval via Semantic a.Role in workflow: Ensures retrieval of literature addressing similar challenges as the user query.

Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Method details: Keyword-based retrieval uses domain-specific keywords extracted from queries and papers to find relevant literature.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Inputs: Expanded keyword set from user query and retrieved papers.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Example: Searching for papers that include keywords like 'memory footprint' or 'optimizer states'.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Role in workflow: Targets literature highly relevant to the user's research area.

Standardized Section Extraction from Lit.Method details: PDF parser extracts titles, abstracts, introductions, methods, and references from papers.
Standardized Section Extraction from Lit.Example: Extracting the 'method' section from a PDF for summarization.
Standardized Section Extraction from Lit.Role in workflow: Enables structured summarization and downstream embedding.

Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Method details: LLMs summarize each paper into structured quintuples: keywords, backgrounds, ideas, concise methods, and references.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Example: Summarizing a paper's background and main idea into a single sentence.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Role in workflow: Facilitates efficient retrieval and idea synthesis.

Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Method details: Prompt engineering extracts motivations, innovative details, and concise methods from paper sections.
Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Inputs: Title, abstract, introduction, and method sections.
Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Example: Extracting three innovative details not mentioned in the summary.
Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Role in workflow: Provides granular information for idea generation.

Task/Entity-Centric Knowledge Graphs.Method details: Paper-keyword graph links each paper to its extracted keywords, capturing co-occurrence relationships.
Task/Entity-Centric Knowledge Graphs.Example: Creating an edge between a paper and the keyword 'Transformer'.
Task/Entity-Centric Knowledge Graphs.Role in workflow: Supports efficient graph-based traversal and retrieval.

Literature Database Construction.Method details: A database of 78,571 AI papers is built, storing structured summaries and embeddings for each.
Literature Database Construction.Example: Database entry includes keywords, background, ideas, concise methods, references, and embeddings.
Literature Database Construction.Role in workflow: Foundation for multi-granularity retrieval and idea generation.

Entity- or Co-Occurrence–Based Databases.Method details: Database records co-occurrence of papers and keywords, enabling neighborhood-based keyword expansion.
Entity- or Co-Occurrence–Based Databases.Example: If 'Transformer' appears in multiple papers, co-occurrence is tracked.
Entity- or Co-Occurrence–Based Databases.Role in workflow: Enables keyword expansion and co-occurrence-based retrieval.

Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Method details: LLM generates ideas using only its internal knowledge, guided by a transformed user query.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Outputs: 3-4 initial ideas described in several sentences.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Example: Brainstorming ideas for reducing memory footprint in LLM finetuning without referencing external papers.
Idea/hypothesis generation without addit.Role in workflow: Provides a baseline set of ideas from the LLM's knowledge.

Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Method details: LLM generates ideas using insights from retrieved literature, including concise method summaries and inspirations.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Inputs: Transformed background and summarized methods/inspirations from retrieved papers.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Outputs: Novel ideas synthesized from literature context.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Example: Generating ideas for RAG systems by integrating methods from multiple retrieved papers.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Role in workflow: Grounds idea generation in current literature, increasing feasibility and relevance.

Summarization Literature data used durin.Method details: LLM summarizes methodology sections of retrieved papers into concise, informative descriptions for use in idea generation.
Summarization Literature data used durin.Example: Summarizing a paper's method to extract actionable insights for idea synthesis.
Summarization Literature data used durin.Role in workflow: Provides focused, relevant context for LLM-based idea generation.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Few-Shot.Method details: Few-shot learning is used to guide LLMs in summarizing methodology sections by providing curated examples.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Few-Shot.Inputs: Manually curated summaries and new methodology sections.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Few-Shot.Example: Providing example summaries to improve LLM output quality.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Few-Shot.Role in workflow: Improves the quality of literature-derived context for idea generation.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Method details: Human researchers (graduate students/PhDs) evaluate generated ideas for novelty, clarity, feasibility, relevance, and helpfulness.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Inputs: Generated ideas from SciPIP and baselines.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Example: Panel of 12 researchers rate ideas on a 0-5 scale for multiple criteria.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Role in workflow: Provides expert validation and comparative assessment of idea quality.
